meanings.definition: A length of something wound in a joined sequence of loops.
meanings.sent1: The snake formed a tight coil to rest on the warm rock.
meanings.sent2: She bought a coil of rope for the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The spring uncoiled with a bounce, surprising the cat.
meanings.sent4: The coil of hair on her head resembled a crown of curls.
meanings.sent5: The metal coil sprang open with a loud clang.

meanings.definition: To wind or twist something into a series of loops.
meanings.sent1: He tried to coil the garden hose neatly for storage.
meanings.sent2: She watched him coil the wire around the pole with precision.
meanings.sent3: The magician coiled the scarf around his hand and made it disappear.
meanings.sent4: His fingers deftly coiled the clay into a perfect pot.
meanings.sent5: The dancer coiled the ribbon around her wrist before twirling it in the air.

meanings.sent1: The seashell had a beautiful coil pattern on its surface.
meanings.sent2: The galaxy displayed a magnificent coil of stars and dust.
meanings.sent3: The coil of smoke from the chimney danced in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The coil of yarn rolled off the table and onto the floor.
meanings.sent5: The coil of steam rose from the hot cup of tea.
